1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: dir.c Fri 10-27-2000 8:49:52 pm HvA V1.00 $
3    | 
4    | DESC: Show directory and pick a filename - HVA_WIN 
5    | HIST: 19911120 V1.00 
6    | 	  20001027 V2.01 - Adapting for DJGPP
7    | ***************************************************************************/
8    | 
9    | /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
10   |                         HEADER FILES
11   | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
12   | #include <stdio.h>
13   | #include <stdlib.h>
14   | #include <conio.h>
15   | #include <string.h>
16   | #include <ctype.h>
17   | #include <dos.h>
18   | #include <direct.h>
19   | #include <unistd.h>		/*+ For getcwd() +*/
20   | #include "keys.h"
21   | #include "window.h"
22   | #include "fortify.h"
23   | 
24   | /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
25   |                         CONSTANTS
26   | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
27   | #define MAX_FILES       100     /*+ Maximum number of files in a directory +*/
28   | #define CELWIDTH         14     /*+ Width of 1 cell in the window          +*/
29   | #define NO_HOR_CELLS      4     /*+ Number of names in 1 row               +*/
30   | #define NO_VERT_CELLS     9     /*+ Number of names in 1 column            +*/
31   | #define MAX_NAME_LENGTH  13     /*+ Maximum length of a filename           +*/
32   | 
33   | /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
34   |                         LOCAL VARIABLES
35   | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
36   | static int window_width  = 0;
37   | static int window_height = 0;
38   | static int no_cells      = 0;
39   | static int row           = 0;
40   | static int col           = 0;
41   | static int filenr        = 0;
42   | static int no_files      = 0;
43   | static int first_file    = 0;
44   | static int parent_dir    = FALSE;
45   | 
46   | #define NAMELEN 132
47   | 
48   | static char original_dir[NAMELEN];  /* Starting directory               */
49   | static char full_path[NAMELEN];     /* Full path to choosen file        */
50   | static char *file[MAX_FILES];       /* Array of pointers to filenames   */
51   | static WINDOW *dir_window;
52   | 
53   | /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
54   |                         PROTOTYPES
55   | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
56   | static int  check_filenr(int nr);
57   | static void get_files(char *mask);
58   | static void display_dir(void);
59   | static void calc_row_col(int nr);
60   | static int  calc_first_file(int filenr);
61   | 
62   | /*===========================================================================
63   |                         START OF FUNCTIONS
64   | ===========================================================================*/
65   | 
66   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
67   | show-dir() - Show a directory. Asks for a filemask and then shows the
68   | directory contents, matching the mask. If the window for the mask was
69   | escaped with ESC_KEY, then don't show the direcory
70   | 
71   | HISTORY: 911211 V0.1 - Initial version
72   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
73   | void show_dir(void)
74   | {
75   |   char filemask[40];
76   |   int ret;
77   | 
78   |   strcpy(filemask,"*.*");
79   |   ret = editstr(action_row+2,action_col+2,30,"File mask",filemask,_DRAW);
80   |   if (ret != ESC)
81   |     get_dir(filemask,filemask);
82   | }
83   | 
84   | /*#+func--------------------------------------------------------------
85   |     FUNCTION: change_dir()
86   |      PURPOSE: change directory
87   |  DESCRIPTION: shows path of current directory, and will ask for a new
88   |               path. If this edit window is escaped by 'ESC' nothing
89   |               will be done, otherwise we change the current directory
90   |      RETURNS: nothing
91   |      HISTORY: 911112 V0.1 - Initial version
92   | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------*/
93   | void change_dir()
94   | {
95   |   char path[81];
96   |   int  ret;
97   | 
98   |   if (getcwd(path,80) != NULL)
99   |   {
100  |     ret = editstr(action_row+2,action_col+2,30,"Enter directory path",path,_DRAW);
101  |     if (ret != ESC)
102  |       chdir(path);
103  |   }
104  |   else
105  |     wn_error("Error in change_dir()");
106  | }
107  | 
108  | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
109  |     FUNCTION: calc_first_file()
110  |      PURPOSE: Calculate number of first file in the window
111  |  DESCRIPTION: -
112  |      RETURNS: nothing
113  |      HISTORY: 911213 V0.1 - Initial version
114  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
115  | static int calc_first_file(int nr)
116  | {
117  |   if (nr >= first_file + no_cells)
118  |   {
119  |     first_file += NO_HOR_CELLS;
120  |     return(first_file);
121  |   }
122  | 
123  |   if (nr < first_file)
124  |   {
125  |     first_file -= NO_HOR_CELLS;
126  |     return(first_file);
127  |   }
128  |   return(nr);		/*+ Default return +*/
129  | 
130  | }
131  | 
132  | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
133  |     FUNCTION: check_filenr()
134  |      PURPOSE: Check if filenr within valid range
135  |  DESCRIPTION: -
136  |      RETURNS: nothing
137  |      HISTORY: 911120 V0.1 - Initial version
138  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
139  | static int check_filenr(int nr)
140  | {
141  |   if (nr < 0)
142  |     nr = 0;
143  |   if (nr >= no_files)
144  |     nr = no_files-1;
145  |   return(nr);
146  | }
147  | 
148  | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
149  |     FUNCTION: calc_row_col()
150  |      PURPOSE: Calculate row and column of a cell number in the window
151  |  DESCRIPTION: -
152  |      RETURNS: nothing.
153  |               Global variables 'row' and 'column' are affected.
154  |      HISTORY: 911120 V0.1 - Initial version
155  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
156  | static void calc_row_col(int cell_nr)
157  | {
158  |   int i;
159  | 
160  |   /*-----------------------------
161  |     Calculate horizontal offset
162  |   ------------------------------*/
163  |   i   = cell_nr % NO_HOR_CELLS;
164  |   col = dir_window->x1+1 + (i * CELWIDTH);
165  | 
166  |   /*----------------------------
167  |     Calculate vertical offset
168  |   ----------------------------*/
169  |   i = ((int) cell_nr / NO_HOR_CELLS);
170  |   if (i >= NO_VERT_CELLS)
171  |     i = NO_VERT_CELLS - 1;
172  |   row = dir_window->y1 + i;
173  | }
174  | 
175  | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
176  |     FUNCTION: display_dir()
177  |      PURPOSE: Display directory in a window
178  |  DESCRIPTION: -
179  |      RETURNS: nothing
180  |      HISTORY: 911213 V0.1 - Initial version
181  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
182  | static void display_dir()
183  | {
184  |   int j;
185  |   int cell_nr;
186  | 
187  |   /*-----------------
188  |     Initializations
189  |   ------------------*/
190  |   filenr = check_filenr(filenr);
191  |   first_file = calc_first_file(filenr);
192  |   j = first_file;
193  |   cell_nr = 0;
194  | 
195  |   /*--------------------------
196  |     Show filenames in window
197  |   ---------------------------*/
198  |   wn_locate(dir_window,0,0);
199  |   while (cell_nr < no_cells && cell_nr < no_files) {
200  |     if (!file[j][0])   /* Check if filename not empty */
201  |       break;
202  |     calc_row_col(cell_nr);
203  |     hotstring(row,col,-1,file[j],_menu_att);
204  |     cell_nr++;
205  |     j++;
206  |   }
207  | 
208  |   /*-----------------------------------
209  |     Clear remainder of menu if needed
210  |   ------------------------------------*/
211  |   while (cell_nr < no_cells)
212  |   {
213  |     calc_row_col(cell_nr);
214  |     hotstring(row,col,-1,"             ",_menu_att);
215  |     cell_nr++;
216  |   }
217  | 
218  |   /*----------------------------------
219  |     Highlight filename under cursor
220  |   ----------------------------------*/
221  |   cell_nr = filenr - first_file;
222  |   calc_row_col(cell_nr);
223  |   hotstring(row,col,-1,file[filenr],_menu_highlight);
224  | }
225  | 
226  | /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
227  |     FUNCTION: get_files()
228  |      PURPOSE: get filenames and subdirs of current directory
229  |  DESCRIPTION: -
230  |      RETURNS: nothing
231  |      HISTORY: 911213 V0.1 - Initial version
232  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
233  | static void get_files(char *mask)
234  | {
235  |   struct find_t filedata;
236  |   int i,j;
237  |   char dir[81];
238  | 
239  |   getcwd(dir,80);
240  | 
241  |   /*--------------------------
242  |     Make all filename empty
243  |   --------------------------*/
244  |   for (i=0 ; i<MAX_FILES ; i++)
245  |     file[i][0] = '\0';
246  | 
247  |   window_width  = NO_HOR_CELLS * CELWIDTH;
248  |   window_height = NO_VERT_CELLS;
249  |   no_cells      = NO_HOR_CELLS * NO_VERT_CELLS;
250  | 
251  |   /*-----------------------------
252  |     Get all matching file names
253  |   ------------------------------*/
254  |   no_files = 0;
255  |   i = 0;
256  |   if (_dos_findfirst(mask,_A_NORMAL,&filedata) == 0)
257  |   {
258  |     do
259  |     {
260  |       strcpy(file[i],filedata.name);
261  |       strlwr(file[i]);
262  |       j = strlen(file[i]);
263  |       strncat(file[i],"            ",12-j);
264  |       i++;
265  |       no_files++;
266  |     }
267  |     while (_dos_findnext(&filedata) == 0 && no_files < MAX_FILES);
268  |   }
269  | 
270  |   /*------------------------------------------
271  |     Add subdirectories. Now use "*.*" as mask
272  |   -------------------------------------------*/
273  |   parent_dir = FALSE;
274  |   if (_dos_findfirst("*.*",_A_SUBDIR,&filedata) == 0)
275  |   {
276  |     do
277  |     {
278  |       if (filedata.attrib & 0x10)       /* If subdirectory      */
279  |       {
280  |         if (filedata.name[0] == '.' && filedata.name[1] == '.')
281  |           parent_dir = TRUE;
282  |         if (filedata.name[0] != '.')   /* Skip current and parent directories */
283  |         {
284  |           strcpy(file[i],filedata.name);
285  |           j = strlen(file[i]);
286  |           strncat(file[i],"\\           ",12-j);
287  |           i++;
288  |           no_files++;
289  |         }
290  |       }
291  |     }
292  |     while (_dos_findnext(&filedata) == 0 && no_files < MAX_FILES);
293  |   }
294  |   if (parent_dir)
295  |   {
296  |     strncat(file[i++],"..\\           ",12);
297  |     no_files++;
298  |   }
299  | 
300  | }
301  | 
302  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
303  |     FUNCTION: get_dir()
304  |      PURPOSE: Show directory in a window and pick a file
305  |  DESCRIPTION: Searches all files in the current directory with
306  |               the mask given, and show them in a window like TC.
307  |               The name of the file picked will be copied in the parameter
308  |               'filename'
309  |      RETURNS: NULL if this function is escaped by <ESC>
310  |               pointer to full path and filename if <ENTER> was used
311  |      HISTORY: 911111 V0.1 - Initial version
312  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
313  | char *get_dir(char *mask, char *filename)
314  | {
315  |   int i;
316  |   unsigned int  key = ESC_KEY;
317  |   char *backslash;
318  | 
319  |   /*--------------------------------
320  |     Allocate memory for file names
321  |   ---------------------------------*/
322  |   for (i=0 ; i<MAX_FILES ; i++)
323  |     file[i] = (char *) malloc(MAX_NAME_LENGTH);
324  | 
325  |   /*------------------------
326  |     Get current directory
327  |   ------------------------*/
328  |   getcwd(original_dir,80);
329  | 
330  |   get_files(mask);
331  | 
332  |   /*------------------------
333  |     Open directory window
334  |   ------------------------*/
335  |   dir_window = wn_open(_SINGLE_LINE, action_row+2, action_col+2,
336  |     window_width+2, window_height+2, _menu_att, _border_att);
337  |   wn_title(dir_window,mask);
338  | 
339  |   /*--------------------------
340  |     Initialize variables
341  |   ---------------------------*/
342  |   filenr = 0;
343  |   first_file = 0;
344  | 
345  |   while (TRUE)
346  |   {
347  |     /*-----------------------------
348  |       Display filenames in window
349  |     ------------------------------*/
350  |     display_dir();
351  | 
352  |     key = waitkey();
353  |     switch(key)
354  |     {
355  |        case ARROW_RIGHT:
356  |          filenr++;
357  |          break;
358  | 
359  |        case ARROW_LEFT:
360  |          filenr--;
361  |          break;
362  | 
363  |        case ARROW_DOWN:
364  |          filenr += NO_HOR_CELLS;
365  |          break;
366  | 
367  |        case ARROW_UP:
368  |          filenr -= NO_HOR_CELLS;
369  |          break;
370  | 
371  |        case ESC_KEY:
372  |          filename[0] = '\0';
373  |          /*------------------------
374  |            Free allocated memory
375  |          ------------------------*/
376  |          for (i=0 ; i<MAX_FILES ; i++)
377  |            free(file[i]);
378  |          chdir(original_dir);     /* Go back to original directory */
379  |          dir_window = wn_close(dir_window);
380  |          return(NULL);
381  |          break;
382  | 
383  |        case ENTER:
384  |          /*---------------------------------------------------
385  |            Check if directory selected. If so, change to this
386  |            directory, get filenames and show directory
387  |          -----------------------------------------------------*/
388  |          backslash = strchr(file[filenr],'\\');
389  |          if (backslash)
390  |          {
391  |            *backslash = '\0';
392  |            if (chdir(file[filenr]) != -1)
393  |            {
394  |              get_files(mask);
395  |              first_file = 0;
396  |              filenr = 0;
397  |              display_dir();
398  |            }
399  |          }
400  |          else
401  |          {
402  |            getcwd(full_path,80);
403  |            strcat(full_path,"\\");
404  |            /*----------------------------
405  |              Check if filename selected
406  |            ----------------------------*/
407  |            if (isalnum(file[filenr][0]))
408  |            {
409  |              strcpy(filename,file[filenr]);
410  |              strcat(full_path,filename);
411  |            }
412  | 
413  |            /*------------------------
414  |              Free allocated memory
415  |            ------------------------*/
416  |            for (i=0 ; i<MAX_FILES ; i++)
417  |              free(file[i]);
418  |            chdir(original_dir);     /* Go back to original directory */
419  |            dir_window = wn_close(dir_window);
420  |            return(full_path);
421  |          }
422  |          break;
423  | 
424  |       default:
425  |         break;
426  |     } /* end of switch() */
427  |   } /* end of while() */
428  | 
429  | }
